title: Perma banned by a rigged system
body:
''Because a player-triggered review found your in-game comms *extremely inflammatory and offensive*, your account's been permanently suspended. You are among the 0.006% of League players negative enough to be permanently banned. Other players judged your comms to be far below the standards of the League community. The vast majority of players agree that while League's an intense competitive game, everyone deserves respect on the Rift.''

Perma banned for this:

(Context): Support starts flaming me because he says I don't know how to jungle and cause him to lose his series. Starts calling me names like ''fucking retard''. Following are the chat logs, I was perma-banned over this one game:

Game 1
Ellipsum: im guessing he actually mustve had vision there
Ellipsum: for some reason
Ellipsum: man you're actually the reason you're losing
Ellipsum: you realise that right
Ellipsum: you dont know how to jungle janna
Ellipsum: dont pretend like it
Ellipsum: nah you dont
Ellipsum: i tihnk its cuz of you
Ellipsum: i think you were
Ellipsum: you just called me a fucking retard
Ellipsum: but im in your elo
Ellipsum: i
Ellipsum: think it's funny
Ellipsum: sure you played those 94 games in 2 days janna?
Ellipsum: you can't lie your way to the top you know that right?
Ellipsum: im reporting you for verbal abuse
Ellipsum: enjoy the mute btw
Ellipsum: sivir is
Ellipsum: sorry this janna is very toxic and flaming since 5 mins
Ellipsum: sivir isnt trolling
Ellipsum: sivir couldnt take the flame anymore and she quit
Ellipsum: well that's what you told me to do
Ellipsum: don't you remember
Ellipsum: always blame the jungler right
Ellipsum: report me if you want i didnt break any rules
Ellipsum: im not the one flaming her
Ellipsum: lol


It's a real shame I can't present you the Janna chat logs though. What do you guys think?

replies.body:
While Necromancy may be handy (and sometimes needed) in video games, it's not the case for old forum threads. Please avoid using such magic and be mindful of how old threads are before posting.

Feel free to contact us at the [Moderation Discord](https://discordapp.com/channels/230113905668653056/306220435262144512) or at [Discuss the Boards]( https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) for any questions, comments or concerns about this. Thank you and have a good day.

> (Context):

Doesn't matter.

> It's a real shame I can't present you the Janna chat logs though.

Also doesn't matter. What other people do has no bearing on what you do.

> What do you guys think?

Well, I see you arguing and harassing the Janna, threatening to report, claiming you muted them (although it looks like you go straight back to flaming them, so I doubt you did), and it also looks like you openly harassed them in /all Chat.

On top of repeating the hate speech you claimed Janna used, you're just altogether really negative and argumentative throughout the match. If you came off of a fourteen-day ban recently, this permanent ban is well-deserved.

When I said enjoy the mute, I meant him getting muted after game because he repeatedly used offensive language.

I conversed in all chat after he asked the opposite team to report me.

Chat logs don't look like anything when you see only one player's texts and not everyone else's. You are stretching interpretations to make it look like I'm the one harassing him...
Threatening to report someone for verbal abuse is a reportable offense now? lolwat

I mean there is very little reason to retaliate. Just press tab, mute the player, and play your game!

I've been trying it recently and it's been a god send idea. If someone speaks anything that I find negative (even jokes) I'll mute them once in-game. From there, I'll mute ANY player that says anything overtly toxic or negative, or spam pings me (I try my best but everyone gets tilted from time-to-time and find the need to be a keyboard warrior).

> When I said enjoy the mute, I meant him getting muted after game because he repeatedly used offensive language.

There is absolutely zero clarity whatsoever in that.

Mute = The mute feature, which silences a player's chat in the muting player's perspective in the respect of a single match.
Chat Restriction = The first and second tiers of punishment, which involve restricted use of the chat feature, given to players who either abuse the chat harshly, or constantly abuse it to a modest degree.

When you say "mute", the only thing people are going to assume is you're referencing you muting them.

As an aside, if Janna really did call you a "fucking retard", it's very likely they would've been hit with a 14-day suspension, since that qualifies as hate speech.

---

> I conversed in all chat after he asked the opposite team to report me.

You don't need to defend yourself. If a bunch of people report you when you haven't done anything wrong, you won't get punished. You should've just muted Janna when they started flaming you, and if anyone on the enemy team started in, mute them too - and report them all after the match.

Retaliating does nothing besides make you just as much a flamer as Janna was.

---

> Chat logs don't look like anything when you see only one player's texts and not everyone else's.

They wouldn't look like anything if you saw everyone else's chat, either - nobody wants to deal with _two_ flamers, let alone one. Counterflaming is still flaming, and, again - nobody wants to deal with that shit. It didn't matter back in the days of the Tribunal, and it doesn't matter now - nor will I imagine it ever mattering.

> Threatening to report someone for verbal abuse is a reportable offense now?

Yes. There is absolutely zero reason you should be telling someone "I'm going to report you" - all that does is serve to cause trouble and make them flame harder - which, again (times two) - **Nobody wants to deal with flamers. All you're doing by threatening to report another is making the situation magnitudes worse for everyone.**

If you're going to report them, report them. You don't need to say a word to them about it.

1. Incorrect use of vocabulary according to you does not change the fact that this is what I meant.
2. Apparently yes I do, look what just happenned to me.
3. My chat logs show no evidence of flaming because I did not, your interpretations of what the overall chat looked like do.
4. Threatening to report someone for verbal abuse stops them from using offensive language most of the time. Plus, regardless of the effect it has, it's not a reportable offense. You're making up rules to justify my ban. This is my last reply to you.
Lets not jump on them too quickly, they were certainly negative but it seems possible that "fucking retard" is just a zero tolerance phrase and repeating it may have triggered the IFS.

Alright I see what you mean.

> And, of course, there's the epitome of irony.
> 
> He flames Janna for essentially the majority of the chat log, says nothing productive, and then claims that he wasn't flaming Janna, and says that he didn't break any rules.

If I read it correctly he was actually referring to the Sivir, saying "I'm not the one who flamed her [into leaving the game]."

> Ignoring the hate speech, this chat is something that can validate a report - and given that he had somewhat recently come off of a two-week suspension two or so months ago, this punishment is deserved.

Perhaps yes, but I'm trying this new thing of showing understanding and optimism to players who have received punishments in the hopes of swaying them to let go of their anger over what happened and instead try to improve.

I'll give on the interpretation of the "im not the one flaming her" quote. It's wholly open to interpretation what he meant by it, so my reference of it may be out of line.

Good on you for the humane approach to it, though. I'll readily admit that when I see someone dismiss the system as "rigged" or claim that we should see the other players' chat to weigh on their own - I'm inclined to be less optimistic and simply highlight the most likely reason they were punished.

Thanks for understanding, that aside though I do see what you mean about the negativity in the rest of their chat.

I too am usually inclined to disapprove of people who dismiss the system as "rigged."

And it's good of you to try to highlight what could have resulted in a punishment. I do that too, but I believe that the person is more likely to listen to me and understand me if I get on their side first. At least that's why I am trying to do it the way I'm doing it now.

Never repeat what anybody says in Pre-game/In-Game/Post-Game chat. Stuff like that gets picked up & automatically flagged by the System. I personally almost never use the Chat system unless I need to call out something like say Dragon or Baron. That or have friendly Early game banter. As for going Straight to PERMA-BAN status, you must have recieved a 14-day ban previously in order to get a Permaban so quickly. As for the Janna, if they didn't get banned this game, they'll get theirs eventually if they keep up their attitude. 
I'd just send in a ticket & wait & see what they say.

If you're being entirely honest about your circumstance then I would think that this is indeed an unjust ban.

Sometimes this happens when you repeat hate speech uttered by other players, as the system picks up on it and will punish you for using that language. The phrase "fucking retard" was probably added to the list of zero tolerance language.

You can always try making a support ticket, as they can review your case and they might reduce the punishment. But if you want that you're going to have to not be rude to them in your ticket.

All that aside I think it's also possible that this chat did result in a punishment and potentially justly so. It's not that the chat by itself warrants a permanent ban, but if you have had a 14-day ban and you haven't recovered your standing since then, it is possible for any level of punishable behavior - no matter how minor - to result in being elevated to the next and final stage of punishment (permaban).

If I had to guess what may have been punishable about your chat (if this ban was somehow justified) then I would say it could have been the fact that you argued back and forth with the Janna for like 7-8 lines about how it's their fault they are losing. Attributing blame isn't really helpful to any situation, and this one especially because the player is clearly already tilted off the face of the earth and flaming. Antagonizing them in this way could potentially be seen as punishable.

Like I said I don't think this chat warrants a punishment. But it's still possible that it did. I don't know 100% how Riot's system judges stuff.
I actually thought the same about the ''repeating hate speech''. This may very well be the reason.

Yeah, it's possible, but like I said it could also be due to the arguing.

Your best bet is to just be as polite and respectful in a support ticket as you can, and hope that they have mercy. Trust me on this one, don't go into it demanding that they do what you want, if you present yourself like an entitled person then they won't want to help you and they might brush off your case.

A combination of retaliation (not allowed, ever, no exceptions, nobody wants to see two brats fighting) and quotation - after a 14 day ban you should have known better.

Since you seem unable to learn or take a warning, riot dropped the banhammer.
